questions.questionText: A man walks 3 km towards East, then turns left and walks 4 km. What is the shortest distance from his starting point?
questions.explanation: The man walks 3 km East and 4 km North (left from East). Using Pythagoras: Distance = √(3² + 4²) = √(9 + 16) = √25 = 5 km. This is the 3-4-5 triplet.

questions.questionText: A person is facing North. He turns 90° clockwise, then 180° anticlockwise. Which direction is he facing now?
questions.explanation: Starting North, 90° clockwise = East. Then 180° anticlockwise from East = 180° counterclockwise = West.

questions.questionText: Ram walks 10 m towards North, turns right and walks 6 m, then turns right and walks 10 m. How far is he from the starting point?
questions.explanation: North 10m (0,10), right/East 6m (6,10), right/South 10m (6,0). Distance from start (0,0) to (6,0) = 6m.

questions.questionText: One morning, a man's shadow fell exactly behind him. In which direction was he facing?
questions.explanation: In the morning, the sun is in the East and shadows fall towards the West. If his shadow is behind him, he must be facing East (opposite to the shadow direction).

questions.questionText: A girl walks 5 m South, then 12 m East. What is the minimum distance from the starting point?
questions.explanation: Using Pythagoras: Distance = √(5² + 12²) = √(25 + 144) = √169 = 13 m. This is the 5-12-13 Pythagorean triplet.

questions.questionText: Starting from his house, Ajay walks 20 m towards North, then turns left and walks 15 m, then turns left again and walks 20 m. In which direction is he from his house?
questions.explanation: North 20m (0,20), left/West 15m (-15,20), left/South 20m (-15,0). From start (0,0) to (-15,0) is West direction.

questions.questionText: A person facing North turns 45° clockwise, then 90° clockwise, then 135° anticlockwise. Which direction is he facing?
Mohan walks 8 m towards East, then 15 m towards North. What is the straight-line distance from his starting point?
questions.explanation: Using Pythagoras: Distance = √(8² + 15²) = √(64 + 225) = √289 = 17 m. This is the 8-15-17 triplet.

questions.questionText: In the evening, Rakesh's shadow was falling to his right. In which direction was he facing?
questions.explanation: Evening sun is in West, shadow falls in East. Shadow to his right means East is to right. If East is right, he is facing North.

questions.questionText: A man walks 40 m towards West, then 30 m towards North, then 40 m towards East. How far is he from the starting point?
questions.explanation: West 40m (-40,0), North 30m (-40,30), East 40m (0,30). Net displacement: 0m East-West, 30m North. Distance = 30m.

questions.questionText: A boy is facing East. He turns 90° anticlockwise, then 90° clockwise, then 180° clockwise. Which direction is he facing?
A walks 6 km towards North, turns right and walks 8 km, then turns right and walks 6 km, then turns right and walks 4 km. How far is A from the starting point?
questions.explanation: North 6km (0,6), right/East 8km (8,6), right/South 6km (8,0), right/West 4km (4,0). Distance from (0,0) to (4,0) = 4 km.

questions.questionText: Ram walks 10 m towards South, then 6 m towards East, then 10 m towards North, then 8 m towards West. How far is he from the starting point?
questions.explanation: South 10m (0,-10), East 6m (6,-10), North 10m (6,0), West 8m (-2,0). Distance from (0,0) to (-2,0) = 2m.

questions.questionText: A man facing South turns left twice and then right. Which direction is he facing now?
questions.explanation: South, left = East, left = North, right = East.

questions.questionText: Two persons A and B are walking towards each other in the morning. If A's shadow falls to his left, in which direction is B's shadow?
questions.explanation: Morning: shadow in West. A's shadow left means A facing North. B facing A means B facing South. For B facing South, shadow (West) is to his right.

questions.questionText: Priya walks 7 m North, then 24 m West, then 7 m South. What is the distance from the starting point?
questions.explanation: North 7m (0,7), West 24m (-24,7), South 7m (-24,0). Net: 24m West, 0m North-South. Distance = 24m.

questions.questionText: A man walks 3 m North, 4 m East, 5 m South, 4 m West. How far is he from the starting point?
questions.explanation: North 3m (0,3), East 4m (4,3), South 5m (4,-2), West 4m (0,-2). Distance from (0,0) to (0,-2) = 2m.

questions.questionText: Starting from point A, a person walks 5 m towards East to point B, then 12 m towards North to point C. What is the distance between A and C?
questions.explanation: Using Pythagoras: Distance = √(5² + 12²) = √(25 + 144) = √169 = 13 m. This is the 5-12-13 triplet.
